name: OcuMOL Leap
tagline: Incorporating the Oculus Rift and Leap Motion into PyMOL.
body:
### 3-D Visualization and Manipulation of Molecules with PyMOL, Leap Motion, and Oculus Rift

This is an **alpha** release of Python software for PyMOL which can be used to visualize (Oculus Rift) and manipulate (Leap Motion) molecules in 3-D. This software has lots of dependencies and peculiarities; it may not work instantly for you (it may not ever work for you)! However, it has been tested on a lonely MacBook Pro and we know it works on that so that being said, feel free to download and play with it, if you can.

### Dependencies
There are some tricks that need to happen.

#### Hardware (obviously)
* Computer
* Oculus Rift
* Leap Motion

#### Software (you may have to install dependencies of dependencies)
* https://github.com/lubosz/python-rift
* https://developer.leapmotion.com/downloads
* https://developer.oculus.com/downloads/
* http://sourceforge.net/projects/pymol/

### Authors and Contributors
This software was developed during HopHacks (Spring, 2015) by Jeliazko Jeliazkov (@lqtza), Max Klein (@telamonian), Henry Lessen (too-cool-for-GitHub), and Mariusz Matyszewski (@matyszm).

### Support or Contact
This is very crude software. If you want to complain about the shape of the rocks, call the universe.
